briefTitle: Using IT to Improve Access, Communication and Asthma in African American and Hispanic/Latino Adults
officialTitle: Using IT to Improve Access, Communication and Asthma in African American and Hispanic/Latino Adults

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* adults predominantly African American and Hispanic/Latino with uncontrolled asthma recruited from low income urban neighborhoods

Exclusion Criteria:

* severe psychiatric or cognitive problems that would make it impossible to understand and complete the protocol.

primary.description: This is a validated test with 6 items each with Likert score 0 to 6, reflecting symptoms over the past week. Lower score is a better outcome. We measured change in Asthma Control Questionnaire score from baseline to at least 12 months.

secondary.description: Quality of life is a 15-item questionnaire with 7 point response scale (1-7), higher score is better quality of life. We measured the change from baseline and over a year.
Emergency department visits for asthma from one year before baseline to one year after baseline.
secondary.timeFrame: one year before baseline to one year after baseline

secondary.description: Hospitalizations for asthma in the year before baseline to one year after baseline.
secondary.timeFrame: Hospitalizations for asthma in the year before baseline to one year after baseline

secondary.description: new prescriptions of prednisone or increases in an already-prescribed dose for an asthma exacerbation measured at baseline and at one year.
secondary.timeFrame: bursts at baseline and at one year
